7.29.23  5:20 pm   What's a collect call? I remember they used tk have those 1-800-Collect commercials with Mr. T and Carrot Top. What happened (past tense since I'm assuming that probably doesn't exist anymore?) when someone would call 1-800-Collect?

Â Â Â Â Â  you make the other person pay for it. you use it when you're at school and you wanna call your mom from the pay phone, but you don't have any quarters. you call 1 800 collect, then a pre-recorded friendly woman, who sounds remarkably similar to the modern USA dialect on google translate or google directions, says "Thank you for calling 1-800 collect. Please enter the number you wish to call, area code first." then you type the number, and then you probably have to say your name, and then it calls the other person, and it says something like (i've never heard this part, so i'm paraphrasing) "some jerk named ______ is calling you and wants you to pay for it. will you accept charges?" and they can say yes or no. and then if they say yes, you'll hear "Your call is connected." and then you are talking to the person

7.29.23  4:00 pm   what is your opinion on Soeparno, an Indonesian military officer and politician who was mayor of Surabaya between the 23 of January 1974 to the 23 of January 1979, that died at the age of 78 years in 2000?

Â Â Â Â Â  no opinion, but i find it a little sneaky to bake factual clauses into a question, because it makes it almost impossible for the other person to contest any of those facts, because the whole thing is wrapped up as a question, and the question is not about whether those facts are true. That being said, i have no particular reason to believe any of the facts you delivered are false, but, i feel the need to point out that you didn't give me the opportunity to do so, so it gives the recipient a sort of 'trapped' feeling. It reminds me of the classic schoolyard tease "why are you an idiot?" and other variations

Â Â Â Â Â  i've never made one, but it depends what you want to transcribe. words only, words and score, camera moves, diacritics, etc

7.29.23  12:49 pm   Do u think life is meaningless?

Â Â Â Â Â no

     If not, what do u think? 

Â Â Â Â Â it has more meaning than the word 'meaningful' could describe. For example, the universe has a lot of atoms in it. you might say the universe is "atomful", but even then that seems like an underestimate of how many atoms in the universe. and i believe there are even more meanings than atoms, so, ........ you do the math

7.29.23  11:10 am   your arrangements have a lot of little fast fills and licks hiding in them that always feel great, they sound natural and spontaneous but also do a lot of subtle things that my brain really likes. in a lot of your videos you'll highlight one and sort of break it down by showing the notation or your hand on the keyboard, which makes me wonder: do you come up with those lines just by playing them, and then analyze the details afterward? or do you compose them in advance so that they sound spontaneous, but they're actually carefully controlled?

Â Â Â Â Â  the big prominent ones are probably written into the song, but the smaller ones are probably found during production. regardless, nowadays i don't use staff notation either way. the big solo in "airport terminal" is improvised. the big solo in "la de da" is mostly improvised except it was written into the song that i would specifically quote "where did all the good times go". a prominent riff such as the one after "celebrate" in "meet me in september", was written with the songwriting, and same for the one at the end. although notation wasn't used. but transcribing notation and chords is trivial for me because i am fluent/literate in notation and chord symbols, so for me that's no harder than writing down a sentence that i heard someone speak

7.29.23  8:45 am   How much time does it take to be creative?

Â Â Â Â Â any amount

Â Â Â Â Â any amount

7.29.23  7:59 am   i have a remote control next to me, and i'm afraid it's reading my mind, do you have any advice on how to stop it

Â Â Â Â Â  no, but: it's probably not as good at reading your mind as you are at reading your own mind. unfortunately, you are not as good at reading your own mind as you could be if you weren't also trying to deal with whether or not the other thing is reading your mind

7.29.23  3:09 am   sometimes when im listening back to the music ive created, i feel a nagging feeling that it isn't up to the quality of other music i like, or maybe doesn't feel like "real music", even though the rational side of me knows its probably fine. have you ever experienced this,

Â Â Â Â Â sure

     and/or do you know anything i can do to rid myself of this?

Â Â Â Â Â try to trick yourself into thinking you made someone else's music. then listen to that music and see how bad it is

7.27.23  9:22 pm   I went to what I like to call the afterlife during my teenage years and I have changed profoundly since then, but I realized that the world did not correspond to this new perspective at all, so I feel incomplete. What should I do? Or what would you do?

Â Â Â Â Â  what i would do in that situation is try to learn as much as i can about this current world we're in, while we're in it. it's sort of like 1 random ice crystal that you will only see just this once, but you'll see patterns that actually resonate with eternity, regardless. you'll be able to see plenty of other ice crystals some other time, but this is the only time you'll see this one. so, you can take a good look at it

7.27.23  3:26 pm   How to do the impossible task of convincing people to change a deeply entrenched habit that unnecessarily(changing said habit does not harm the person who changed) negatively affects others, when there are no visible, legal, physical, or social repercussions to such people in continuing to remain as they are? How can I do this successfully while still remaining doing my office job(as leaving job just to convince people may not pay at all,i.e., it may pay but it is extremely risky)? Especially if I feel like the only way I can successfully convince someone is if I have a lot of time to sit around convincing every passerby(job takes up lot of time, with the little time I have left for convincing people, my efforts seem to be bearing no fruit)?

Â Â Â Â Â creating deliberate change happens from the inside out. the first person you truly have access to, from the inside, is yourself. your access to everyone else (from the inside) is unfortunately limited at this time. so therefore, it's been quite common that the most powerful results are found (for oneself, and, also, the world in general) when people look within and make changes there first. in other words, you started off by wondering how to change other people. but why aren't they changing themselves? perhaps, they are too busy trying to change someone else actually ...........

7.27.23  2:36 pm   hello!! first, i just wanna say that i love your music, i appreciate the fact that you put your songs onto spotify :D

second, do you respond to every question you get? also, are the most current questions answered the most current questions asked too?

Â Â Â Â Â the date and time next to the question is based on when the question was asked

     third, do you spend a lot of time finding ideas for songs/other projects

Â Â Â Â Â yes

     or do they just randomly come to you

Â Â Â Â Â also yes

     and you deem them good enough to produce into reality?

Â Â Â Â Â at a different time. Idea finding sessions happen, and, alternately, ideas may hit me at other times when i'm not expecting it. Either way, the process of selecting which one to produce next is a separate isolated task, not related to the time that the idea first happened

     have a nice day (or night)!

Â Â Â Â Â
